alert.note: Alert for Audubon; Carroll; Guthrie (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 10:50AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Guthrie, northeastern Audubon and southeastern Carroll Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1049 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Audubon, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail and additional rainfall up to one inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Guthrie, northeastern Audubon and southeastern Carroll Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
